definition: far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)

sentences.english: We were going to travel together to as far as Paris.
sentences.chinese: 我們曾打算一起遠遊到巴黎。

sentences.english: The Master said, "When your parents are alive, do not travel far."
sentences.chinese: 子嶽，“父母在，不遠遊，遊必有方。”

sentences.english: Parents, not to travel, swim will be well.
sentences.chinese: 父母在，不遠遊，遊必有方。

sentences.english: He had travelled far, had seen much of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他曾經遠遊，見過許多世面。

sentences.english: Xiaozhang is planning to spend the long national holiday travelling abroad.
sentences.chinese: 小張準備利用今年國慶長假出國遠遊。

definition: to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to rise early and sleep late (idiom); to work hard/to study diligently/to burn the candle at both ends
lit. both sleeves flowing in the breeze (idiom); having clean hands/uncorrupted/unsoiled by corrupt practices
(literary) (of a married woman) to visit one's parents
homeless and miserable/forced to leave home and wander from place to place/to live as a refugee
